review: The picture is very dark on this and the picture quality in general seems to be very lacking. There is no options in the settings to adjust the brightness or contrast, only the resolution. I had to put the brightness all the way up on my tv settings, to the point where it is way too bright for normal tv viewing (I use over the air for local channels and apple tv for streaming). Its hard to deal with the dark picture already, but on top of that the quality in general seems to be below 720p.

review: I spend all day figuring out complicated technology, so I wanted something simple, elegant and easy for my home TV streaming. The Fire TV stick promised that, but disappointingly did not deliver. I love the Amazon ecosystem, and admittedly, the initial installation and setup of the Stick was quite fine. I also liked the clever packaging of the product, the box held everything securely without much excess waste. Then, though, came the fatal flaw. Netflix. Like most 'net TV watchers, it's all about Netflix for me, and the Fire TV Stick Netflix app just plain would -not- work. Type in the user and password, and it churns for a moment before kicking back out to the home screen. I tried uninstalling, reinstalling, changing my netflix password, rebooting the stick, unplugging and replugging the stick, reverting to factory defaults and setting it back up, weird DNS voodoo on my firewall; Nothing would make netflix go. So sorry, Amazon, this one was a disappointment for me.

review: This item was purchased for my wife as a birthday present.  We have a Chromecast and love love it. However, She wanted the option to stream amazon prime.  This purchase was a big mistake.  The Netflix app is non functional. We cant even get past the login page.  The log in page has a programming error. Amazon will not admit it is on there end and a hardware error.  They keep wanting Netflix to fix the problem. I have been on the phone with tech support for about a total of 4 hours they keep bouncing me around from department to department and will not replace my device.  Tech support assumes that any problem is user error and not a device error.
